author: Brodie Robertson | Linux Tips & Tricks
description:
Recently the maintainer for LibXML2 just stepped down in what might seem like a case coming out of nowhere but it turns out this was a problem building up a long time.

==========Support The Channel==========
► Patreon: https://brodierobertson.xyz/patreon
► Paypal: https://brodierobertson.xyz/paypal
► Liberapay: https://brodierobertson.xyz/liberapay
► Amazon USA: https://brodierobertson.xyz/amazonusa

==========Resources==========
LibXML2 Commit: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/commit/9c80a89af2fdf4f853892f84e46580f4902658ba
Other Issue: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/issues/346
New Maintainer: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/commit/0704f52ea4cd0cf82253bb2af3f70a09d428629d
Recent Problem: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/issues/976

========
title: FOSS Is Always One Maintainer From Collapsing
